column4: Hey there. I'm trying to install on a toshiba network, and at partitioning, I get an input/outpur error on dev/sda
what could the problem be? corrupt flash?
sorry for not pecifying, but i'm installing from USB
can you open gparted, take a screenshot and imagebin it.
how about a imagebin of gparted.
well, i can tell you that sda didn't even show up
ah did you look in the disk utility?
I recognize the fdisk did not see it a swell
correct
does windows still boot?
no. I disabled AHCI, but haven't tried win yet
that might have done it. installer now recogs the windows part
oops! creating ext part failed
how many partitions do you see?
3, all ntfs
post a screenshot of bgparted now, in imagebin.
since disabling ahci in bios i have sda1 (about 1500m label System), 2 (223gb (label Tl103127W0E) and 3 (7gb - recovery)
if you want help then consider following requests.
i'm operating off of two machine now, it's a bit cumbersome, please understand
I'm not to into 20 questions.
/dev/sda2 (main windows partition) has at least 923 bad sectors
